job_title: AI Tools Developer for Plant Researchers and Breeders
job_purpose: Develop open-source AI tools to assist plant researchers and breeders in efficiently accessing and analyzing large datasets for data-driven research and improved grain varieties development.
job_duties_and_responsibilities: Develop open-source AI tools for plant researchers and breeders to navigate and extract relevant information from complex datasets
Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to create intuitive web-based tools for data exploration and analysis
Contribute significantly to project delivery independently and as part of a team
Communicate project outputs to various stakeholders and report on project progress
Utilize AI techniques such as large language models and knowledge graphs to enhance data accessibility for researchers
required_qualifications: Proven programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages
Experience in developing AI-driven applications using large language models and knowledge graphs
Demonstrated experience with graph databases (e.g., Neo4j), web front-end frameworks, and API development
Strong time management skills and ability to deliver project milestones independently and within a team setting
Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills
Ability to engage effectively with stakeholders and build professional relationships
preferred_qualifications: Post-graduate degree in computer science, data science, artificial intelligence, or related field
company_details: Agriculture Victoria Research is dedicated to developing innovative solutions for plant scientists and breeders by creating open-source tools that facilitate data-driven research and accelerate the development of improved grain varieties. The organization operates within AgriBio, a cutting-edge biosciences research center, fostering collaboration among scientists and technical staff specializing in plant genetic resources, crop genetic improvement, genomics, and bioinformatics.
